text: Hi there! <@U7K185TUN> and I are looking for opinion on organization naming for Constraint programming in Julia. You can vote on <https://discourse.julialang.org/t/constraint-programming-organization-search-for-a-name/51923/18|discourse> ! :penguin_with_the_improbably_large_brain:

attachments.title: Constraint Programming Organization - Search for a name
attachments.text: Hi everyone, @Azzaare and I are planning to create a GitHub organization for constraint programming. As you know naming is one of the 2 or 3 hard problems for us developers. Therefore, we are looking for help. We’ve created a list of possible names. Now it’s your time to cast and/or add a suggestion in the comments :wink: poll Thanks everyone on various platforms to help with coming up with some of these and thank you for voting! We’ll let you know once the decision is made and the organiza...
attachments.fallback: JuliaLang: Constraint Programming Organization - Search for a name

elements.text: and I are looking for opinion on organization naming for Constraint programming in Julia. You can vote on

text: IMO it’s probably better long-term to be simple and explicit, like `JuliaConstraints` or `JuliaConstrainedOptimization`. Then people who don’t already know what this is, but read it when scanning some list looking for something else, won’t be confused. Unlike package names, users will probably never have to type this in.

elements.text: IMO it’s probably better long-term to be simple and explicit, like

. Then people who don’t already know what this is, but read it when scanning some list looking for something else, won’t be confused. Unlike package names, users will probably never have to type this in.

text: I think “cutesy” names are actually off-putting and feel like “in jokes”

elements.text: I think “cutesy” names are actually off-putting and feel like “in jokes”

text:
Well, this is a difficult topic. I thought like you before, but the feedback I got from non julian users on other stuff made me change my mind.
Anyway, it is a good feedback, and <@U7K185TUN> and I need to think carefully about it!
Thankfully, an organization's name can change. So we  mainly have to be sure to not mess up the packages names haha
